definition: Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 剎多羅, Sanskrit ksetra)

sentences.english: The bells of the old temple resounded throughout the valley.
sentences.chinese: 古刹钟声在山谷中回荡。

sentences.english: He discovers ancient temples with long lost treasures and menacing traps.
sentences.chinese: 他发现与失散多年的珍品和险恶陷阱古刹。

sentences.english: Huangshan in the Jin dynasty, when Buddhism introduced, under the peak Regulus Regulus temple was built.
sentences.chinese: 佛教在晋朝时传入黄山，轩辕峰下曾建有轩­辕古刹。

sentences.english: The ancient Shuiyan Temple built a thousand years ago is the unique place for Buddhism activities in the eastern part of Hebei Province.
sentences.chinese: 千年古刹水岩寺是冀东地区唯一的佛教活动场所。

sentences.english: Longju Temple, established during the Sui Dynasty (581-618), is a representative of the historic relics on the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 隋代修建的龙居古刹是这座名山的代表作。

sentences.english: The Longju Temple established during the Sui Dynasty (581-618) is the representative of the historic relics on the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 隋代修建的龙居古刹是这座名山的代表作。

sentences.english: The ancient Buddhist temple is ringed around with hills.
The ancient temple ruined in the war will be reconstructed soon.
sentences.chinese: 这座在战争中被毁坏的古刹不久将重建。
是一座真正的千年古刹。

sentences.english: The roof of the ancient temple caved in because of bad maintenance.
sentences.chinese: 那座古刹由于维护不好屋顶塌了下来。

sentences.english: Master Xiuxiu and his seven pupils live in an old mountain temple.
sentences.chinese: 一深山古刹隐居着休休大师和七个小罗汉。

sentences.english: The old temple was restored during the early nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 这座古刹是在19世纪初期重建的。

sentences.english: The bell in the ancient temple rang throughout the valley.

definition: lit. morning bell, evening drum, symbolizing monastic practice (idiom); fig. encouragement to study or progress
(literary) halls (of a palace or a temple)
stupa/tower venerating the ashes of the Buddha
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
